Key Match Events: Stephen Curry hit two clutch 3-pointers, the second followed by his signature 'night night' celebration in the Warriors' 127-116 victory over the Thunder in Oklahoma City on Sunday.

The Warriors seemingly felt a bit of deja vu, having begun their road trip with a 31-point lead against the Rockets that turned into a narrow overtime victory. Oklahoma City cut the Warriors' once 30-point lead to as few as six, but the Dubs were able to prevent going to overtime.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry scored a season-high 36 points in 36 minutes.
The Warriors finished the difficult road trip with a 4-1 record, with impressive wins over the 7-1 Boston Celtics and the 8-1 Thunder.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonathan Kuminga scored 12 points in the second quarter, helping the Warriors turn a seven-point deficit into a seven-point lead.
De'Anthony Melton started for the first time as a Warrior in his second game back from a lower back strain. Melton had his highest scoring output as a Warrior, finishing with 19 points.
Others: Draymond Green dished out a game-high 11 assists, generating 25 points for the Warriors.
The Warriors will return to Chase Center for the Emirates NBA Cup, beginning against Klay Thompson, Luka Doncic, Kyrie Irving and the Dallas Mavericks on Tuesday.
